data.event_message_data: Message data to be included in the `imap_content` event data:

data_description.charset: The character set used. Common values are `utf-8` or `US-ASCII`.
data_description.event_message_data: Note that the event size is limited, and not all message text might be sent with the event if the message is too large.
data_description.folder: In generally the folder is set to `INBOX`, but e.g. in case of a sub folder, named `Test`, this should be `INBOX.Test`.
data_description.port: The IMAP port supporting SSL, usually this is 993.
data_description.search: The IMAP search command which is `UnSeen UnDeleted` by default.
data_description.ssl_cipher_list: If the IMAP service only supports legacy encryption, try to change this.
data_description.verify_ssl: Recommended, to ensure the server certificate is valid. Turn off, if the server certificate is not trusted (e.g. self-signed).

data.enable_push: Enable Push-IMAP if the server supports it. Turn off if Push-IMAP updates are unreliable.

data_description.custom_event_data_template: This template is evaluated when a new message was received, and the result is added to the `custom` attribute of the event data.
data_description.enable_push: Using Push-IMAP is recommended. Polling will increase the time to respond.
data_description.event_message_data: Note that the event size is limited, and not all message text might be sent with the event if the message is too large.
data_description.folder: In generally the folder is set to `INBOX`, but e.g. in case of a sub folder, named `Test`, this should be `INBOX.Test`.
data_description.max_message_size: Limit the maximum size of the event. Instead of passing the (whole) text message, using a template is a better option.
data_description.search: The IMAP search command which is `UnSeen UnDeleted` by default.
